editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.author: JOHN ASHENDEN
msItem.title: Summa de accidentibus mundi
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in d. 7 c. 8) mmum pauca in rebus in quibus proscrutabuntur
msItem.finalRubric: (f. 40) Completa est igitur hec compilacio tractatus primi summe iudicialis de accidentibus mundi in ciuitate Oxonie per magistrum Iohannem de Eshenden 20 die mensis Iulii anno Christi 1347.
msItem.incipit: (f. 41) Incipit prologus in tractatus summe iudicialis de accidentibus mundi. Sicut dicit Aristoteles 2. ethicorum c. 8 sermones generales et amores particulares animi sunt ueriores ...
msItem.note: Pr. Venice 1489 (GW 9392); Carmody, p. 171; eTK 0761K, 1482A; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 206–7, not this copy. f. 41v is blank.

At the foot of f. 2v, s. xv, is a table of zodiacal signs, beg. ‘Aries dominatur in Florencia, Fauencia et Britania maiori’; most of the place-names are Italian. Circular diagrams in the lower margins of fols. 4, 5v-6, 19, 35v, in the text at f. 7. The text of tract. 1 has been corrected in the margins; throughout is marginal annotation of ss. xiv and xv; running heads of s. xiv.

physDesc.p: A substantial fragment from near the beginning of a large book.

supportDesc.extent:
74 leaves (i + 73) 330 240
240 155
The edges heavily retrimmed, removing portions of diagrams in the lower margins.
supportDesc.foliation: Early foliation in arabic numerals runs 40–9, 53–112.
supportDesc.collation: 112(lacks 1–3), 212(lacks 2–4), 3–612, 78(lacks 7–8); catchwords. Two quires are missing from the beginning; the outer margins of fols. 2, 48, 68, the outer and lower margins of f. 69, and the outer col. of f. 40, have been excised. Most of fols. 71 and 72 have been ripped out.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon in 2 cols, written in c. 49 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A gothic rotunda bookhand influenced by anglicana, of the usual university type.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red paraphs, highlighting and underlining. Tables and diagrams in red and ink of text.

binding.p: s. xix in., sewn on six bands. Fols. i and 73 are blank paper binding leaves.

history.acquisition: Bought by the College at the Powis Castle sale, Davis & Orioli, London, lot 22, 20 March 1923.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
